column4: i have a bunch of .avi files i want to convert to mpeg so i can burn them to a dvd and watch them on a dvd player. what would the workflow be in ubuntu to do so? I have tried using devede but it seems to only be able to put four ~175Mb files onto one dvd.is there a better option?
devede should allow more than 4 video files
yea thats what i thought. the only thing i can think of is that its trying to put all the extra files on to the dvd/iso as well.
i have used ffmpeg to convert, and devede to make the dvd (choosing the valid dvd format) option or something similar, so devede didnt do any converting
ok, ill check that out. thanks
ok each avi i have is 170mb and selecting one in devede takes nearly 25% of the disk space on a dvd. so how am i supposed to fit more than 4 avi's onto the iso to burn it
well even then it shouldnt go from 170 mb to nearly over 1gb for one avi file.
heh, well it seems that the default bit rate is 5001 kbps
have a switch on your laptop for wireless?
yea but its always red, it never worked before. ill try though...
yea pressing the button doesnt work. its just the touch sensitive button. not a real button
your laptop has a touch sensitive button to control the wireless lol
yea, but its never worked in ubuntu before
any other idea what i could try to get it to work?
nope ive got no ideas, get intel wirelss lol
you can recreate the partition without formatting in the same place to recover it, im sure there are programs to search for the position of a lost partition if you dont know the exact location
well im scanning the drive with testdisk, but its a rather large drive (1TB) so its going to take ages.
